About

Based in Seattle, WA

Born in Miami, FL; surviving the heat used to be my primary goal.
Now I am the heat!

I've always had a passion for improving things. I seek out what needs doing and enjoy the process as much as the result. That's probably why I went into this field in the first place.

Recently, I graduated from North Seattle College with a Bachelor's of Applied Science in Application Development at >3.5 GPA. Studying Computer Science, I spent time not only learning data structures & algorithms or what to do with Big Data, but spent months with hands on experience in practicum with clients. This exposed me to different technologies, yes, though more impactful to me was real time experience in handling leadership roles and taking initiative, which I now fear help me be a better developer...

As a nerd, I find it fun to play around with home networking and programming useless devices and Raspberry Pi-ing things just because it is nice to hear my mechanical keyboard in action.

Each day, I aim to learn something new, then can't wait to put it to good use! If you would like to build something together, reach out~*


On my off time, my puppy Bongo and I go frolic into the wilds. Sometimes, I'm engaging with my music, playing bass guitar. I also can cream anyone at Super Smash Bros, so watch out!

Currently seeking full-time opportunities!

View My Resume


Languages: English, Spanish, Java, Python, Golang, Javascript...

Educational focuses: web application development, data structures and algorithms, database technology, cloud infrastructure...

I am presently seeking a good fit with other collaborative and dedicated folks. If you think we would work well together, I'd love to hear from you!

My most recent experience was at SAP Concur as a Software Design Engineer Intern. It was so invigorating I stayed a little longer than planned, before returning to see myself through the finish line of my student career. I worked in Golang and Java, developing a solution for big data migrations, among other projects, and gained invaluable knowledge in code ownership and agile workflow with a fantastic team.

Prior, I was part of a team of students working to gain experience practically. We had short term contracts with clients, developing different apps and services. My work has involved database design and serverless APIs, cloud infrastructure and cybersecurity. With this, I've played a variety of roles while we spun up apps and services on platforms like AWS, Azure, Firebase from the ground up to production.

In the past, I have created and deployed Python scripts, automating secure data input in real-time, saving hundreds of employee hours. Presented research and proof of concept in migrating databases from legacy; then launching custom scripts and ensuring future-proofing.

I have a background in psychology and incorporate that in my designs, facilitating the connection between user and technology while using the most effective communications in documentation.
